executable.title: Automatic FLAIR Threshold
executable.description: This is a CLI supporting module and it is supposed to not be used directly with a simple input image
executable.contributor: Antonio Carlos Senra Filho (University of Sao Paulo), Luiz Otavio Murta Junior (University of Sao Paulo)

image.name: brainLabels
image.label: Brain Tissue Labels
image.description: A lesion map informing the white matter, gray matter and CSF volumes. This tissue map must be organized in the following way: CSF=1, GM=2, WM=3 and BACKGROUND=0. The Basic Brain Tissues module output can be used here. In the case that your tissue mask has different values, please set the variables Gray Matter Mask Value and White Matter Mask Value.

float.name: absErrorThreshold
float.label: Absolute Error Threshold
float.description: Define the absolute error threshold for gray matter statistics. This measure evaluated the similarity between the MNI152 template and the T2-FLAIR gray matter fluctuation estimative. A higher error gives a higher variability in the final lesion segmentation.

float.name: gamma
float.label: Gamma
float.description: Define the outlier detection based on units of standard deviation in the T2-FLAIR gray matter voxel intensity distribution.

float.name: wmMatch
float.label: White Matter Lesion Match
float.description: Set the local neighborhood searching for label refinement step. This metric defines the percentage of white matter tissue that surounds the hyperintense lesions. Higher values defines a conservative segmentation.

integer.name: minimumSize
integer.label: Minimum Lesion Size
integer.description: Set the minimum lesion size adopted as a true lesion in the final lesion map. Units given in number of voxels.

integer.name: gmMaskValue
integer.label: Gray Matter Mask Value
integer.description: Set the mask value that represents the gray matter. Default is defined based on the Basic Brain Tissues module output.

integer.name: wmMaskValue
integer.label: White Matter Mask Value
integer.description: Set the mask value that represents the white matter. Default is defined based on the Basic Brain Tissues module output.
